hesml.taxonomy

Interface ITaxonomy

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Taxonomy

    public interface ITaxonomy
    This interface represents an abstract taxonomy as defined in the paper below. Lastra-Díaz, J. J., and García-Serrano, A. (2016). HESML: a scalable ontology-based semantic similarity measures library with a set of reproducible experiments and a replication dataset. Submitted for publication to the Information Systems Journal.
    Author:
    Juan Lastra-Díaz

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IVertex addVertex(java.lang.Long vertexId, java.lang.Long[] parentVertexes)
      This function inserts a novel vertex in the graph
      void clear()
      Remove all the objects and destroys the taxonomy.
      void computesCachedAttributes()
      This functions computes several cached values such as the node depth.
      IEdgeList getEdges()
      Collection of non-oriented edges in the taxonomy.
      IVertex getLCS(IVertex begin, IVertex end, boolean useLongestDepth)
      This function computes the lowest common subsumer (ancestor), which is defined as the common ancestor with highest depth.
      IVertex getMICA(IVertex begin, IVertex end)
      This function returns the most informative common ancestor (MICA) vertex between the two input vertexes.
      double getSumLeafProbability()
      This function returns the sum of the probability for the leaf nodes.
      IVertexList getVertexes()
      This functions returns the collection of ordered vertexes in the taxonomy.

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        void clear()
        Remove all the objects and destroys the taxonomy.

      • getSumLeafProbability

        double getSumLeafProbability()
        This function returns the sum of the probability for the leaf nodes.
        Returns:
        The overall probability for the leaf nodes.

      • addVertex

        IVertex addVertex(java.lang.Long vertexId,
                  java.lang.Long[] parentVertexes)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        This function inserts a novel vertex in the graph
        Parameters:
        vertexId - Integer unique key for the new vertex
        parentVertexes - Key ID for the parent vertexes.
        Returns:
        The new vertex inserted into the taxonomy
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - The vertexID already exists in the taxonomy, or any parent ID does not match any existent vertex

      • computesCachedAttributes

        void computesCachedAttributes()
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        This functions computes several cached values such as the node depth. This function assumes that the taxonomy has been already defined.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An unexpected exception

      • getVertexes

        IVertexList getVertexes()
        This functions returns the collection of ordered vertexes in the taxonomy. The list is totally ordered from the root, what means that each vertex is subsequent to all its parents.
        Returns:
        Ordered collection of vertexes within the taxonomy

      • getEdges

        IEdgeList getEdges()
        Collection of non-oriented edges in the taxonomy.
        Returns:
        A edge list containig all the non-oriented edges in the taxonomy

      • getMICA

        IVertex getMICA(IVertex begin,
                IVertex end)
         throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                java.lang.Exception
        This function returns the most informative common ancestor (MICA) vertex between the two input vertexes. The computation is made by retrieving on-the-fly the ancestor set from each vertex and searching for the common ancestor with the highest IC value.
        Parameters:
        begin - First input vertex
        end - Second input vertex
        Returns:
        The most informative common ancestor (MICA) vertex
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - A MICA vertex was not found
        java.lang.Exception

      • getLCS

        IVertex getLCS(IVertex begin,
               IVertex end,
               boolean useLongestDepth)
        throws java.lang.Exception
        This function computes the lowest common subsumer (ancestor), which is defined as the common ancestor with highest depth. The function returns the first vertex in the LCS set, although could exist more than one on multiple inheritance taxonomies.
        Parameters:
        begin - First vertex
        end - Second vertex
        useLongestDepth - This parameter indicates whether the method will use the length of the shortest ascending path value (FALSE) as depth value for the search process, or the longest ascending path (TRUE). We recall that depth attribute is ambiguous on multiple-inheritance taxonomies as WordNet.
        Returns:
        The first LCS vertex
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - There is no any common subsumer
